name: Gmail minimal
description: Removes the labels sidebar and other clutter from the Gmail web interface.
additional_info:
This User Style removes a lot of clutter from the Gmail interface, making it ideal to run in its own Application window. It removes the labels sidebar, so you'll need to use Gmail a bit differently than you're used to if you use this style:
  1. Instead of pressing the Compose button, press Shift-C. This will open a new window in which you can compose your message. (Press "?" in Gmail to view a list of all shortcuts)
  2. Instead of labels, use the search box to find what you need. You can filter on sender by searching for: "from:". You can view mail with a label by searching for "in:
I like to run Gmail as a Desktop webapp instead of directly in my main browser. To do this in Chrome, browse to gmail, menu -> tools -> create application shortcut.
